website_summaries.verdict: A good budget option for gaming with an ASUS Prime motherboard without breaking the bank.
pros: Handles a good amount of fast ram for speedy gaming
Integrated audio and USB 3.0 ports eliminate the need for extra desktop accessories
cons: Onboard graphics do not support graphic-intensive games at high resolutions and frame rates

customer_reviews.title: It's a decent motherboard. Only complaint is that the ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent motherboard. Only complaint is that the user guide can be improved. The pin-out for the 20-5 pin System Panel Connector is not shown, so if you're wondering how to connect it to your case, see the attached picture:
customer_reviews.author: DaleM

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well but location of PCIe x1 slots not ideal
customer_reviews.text: Everything appears to work really well and be of high quality. Seems relatively future proof with USB-C and M.2 NVMe memory slots built in. The only complaint I have are the two PCIe x1 slots are useless if you're planning on installing a large PCIe x16 graphics card that is extra thick (like my ASUS GTX 1060 Dual). Installing that extra thick and somewhat long graphics card also blocked a couple SATA ports so effectively only 4 of the 6 SATA ports are usable.
customer_reviews.author: T-Diddy

customer_reviews.title: A nice and great motherboard for the essentials.
customer_reviews.text: A great simple motherboard for those needing to get a system up and running with the essentials. UEFI is clean and easy to navigate, features are great for the price. Has some simple orange lighting on the motherboard which can be set to breathe or remain steadily lit. 6 SATA III ports give it plenty of storage options and 2 M.2 slots are a nice to have too. 4 slots of DDR4 memory give it plenty of room to upgrade later down the road. However do note that if you do use a SATA M.2 SSD in place, the first SATA port will be disabled. So do not panic.
customer_reviews.author: Hikasbit

customer_reviews.title: product was used
customer_reviews.text: product was used when i recieved it but i needed a mb so i didnt care.. the usb 3.0 port on the board was doa and i bet thats why it was sent back by original owner. i know it was used because i found a hyper x sticker inside the box. i checked with asus support and the usb 3.0 port is in fact dead.. but like i said i needed a mb so it something i had to deal with until upgrade time
customer_reviews.author: Johny

customer_reviews.title: Solid board
customer_reviews.text: Thank god it worked!!! Im excited to see how it performs! Negative, only one usb plug in. And the instructions fail to identify the plug in pins for front panel controls. Labels on the board are red on black, terrible way to try and read. The person who assembled the manual was obviously and idiot. But dealing with idiots is an everyday thing. Ya just get used to it. Thank god for Google lol!
customer_reviews.author: Sd

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard is amazing! So many great features. My favorite is how easy it was to install drivers and update bios via the aisuite utility. Also you have full control over all your fans via the aisuite. The bios is very easy to navigate with the EZmode makes it easy to see all the info you need. Would definitely recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: I should have known!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I read the website car fully, but using an nvme drive takes some of the pci lanes. It could also be a limitation of my i3, by it will not support 3 graphics cards. I have two hooks up working great but the third is not recognized. I can’t be bothered to switch to usb windows and maybe try again without the nvme but maybe one day. Otherwise the board is pretty good. No issues and love having the onboard graphics! Can go wrong for the price really.
customer_reviews.author: ChemNerd

customer_reviews.title: A good deal when sold and shipped by Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Went in easily and booted right up. Great combination of features and cost. Wait to buy it when Amazon periodically sells and ships it, though. You'll save considerable money. Other suppliers charge a lot more for this board.
customer_reviews.author: K. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Perfect board
customer_reviews.text: I actually replaced a faulty Prime Z270-a (also Asus) with this b250.. With a 7700K and an M.2 ssd, this board has been so much more reliable. It was warped, which concerned me prior to firing it up. But bent, warped, etc or not, it worked fine, and was surely brand new.
customer_reviews.author: DeX99SS

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great board per cost, booted first time, no memory issues and all works great. I've had problems with higher end boards and feed up with compatibly issues with memory, ssd's m2 and other driver issues. This board is very simple but works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Move along unless this is your only choice for an 8th gen
customer_reviews.text: If you need an 8th gen mobo, get something else. Max ram speed is 2133MHz and gives lower pc rating than many competitive with the same hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: Nice motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Loaded this with 32GB of RAM and an i5 to run as a server in my house. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Ryner

customer_reviews.title: Balanced as it should be
customer_reviews.text: I really like it for a cheaper PC build and it's a strong option just remember that it is give and take and will not be full featured.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan E

customer_reviews.title: Awesome MOBO
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard is great and easy to setup. BIOS is pre-configured for UEFI, easy to get going with Windows 10. You may able to turn UEFI into Legacy for Windows 7. Enough room for my RAM and graphic card.
customer_reviews.author: UberGeeks

customer_reviews.title: Asus Prime B250M-C/CSM Mainboard
customer_reviews.text: I installed the Asus Prime B250M-C/CSM Mainboard in a rackmount 3u PC case and was pleased the way how it was easy to work with and install other components such as serial ports, USB ports, and a PCI USB Card with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jaysen A. Delauney

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a simple motherboard for my i5-7400 and this board fit the bill. Previously had a gigabyte mobo that failed in 7 months, but I've never had an issue with asus motherboards so decided to buy this one. Bios is very intuitive and very easy to install. Great quality. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Huy

customer_reviews.title: Good board for more experienced builders
customer_reviews.text: Good board, lots of features at a good price. However documentation is not so good for novice builders. I have built many and didn't have a problem but a first-time builder would.
customer_reviews.author: R. Garbini

customer_reviews.title: Good board and value so far.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as a NAS. Has 2 more Sata ports then most B250 boards. Its been running fine since March 2019
customer_reviews.author: BigTim

customer_reviews.title: got for 2nd computer
customer_reviews.text: will not work right with windows 7 but windows 10 working right now. i will update if things change.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmic Man

customer_reviews.title: The DIMM slots have one little clip instead of two like some others
customer_reviews.text: Had no issues installing into case, actually went quite smoothly and the only difficulty was slotting it into the back I/O plate. But no more trouble than any other standard motherboard. The DIMM slots have one little clip instead of two like some others. But otherwise pretty standard for any motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Julio

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Ubuntu 16
customer_reviews.text: Used this motherboard to build a Linux-based home NAS. Works great with Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, Core i3-7100, 16 GB ram, m.2 SSD + 4x SATA drives.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Motherboard works great, easy to setup, and enough bios customization to have it run how I like.
customer_reviews.author: Shade Koopa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install CPU and cooling fan
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install CPU and cooling fan. Did not seem to like Windows 7 but Windows 10 Pro installed fine.,
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Linebarger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome motherboard!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome motherboard! Why buy a cheap name brand when you can get the best at this price!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard fit like a glove in my Emachine T5062, all I have to do next is connect all the wires in the right place.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: This Asus motherboard is the worst. Delivered dead on arrival. I expect compensation from Asus directly for the time and money I spent on this motherboard. ASUS, Contact me now For compensation.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous420

customer_reviews.title: Met all expectations
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat easy to install and setup product at a great price point. Asus reliability and functionality. Manual is poor in comparison to other manufactures but a quick Google search for pin header breakdowns solved all problems.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: Return process was a pain time wise but it works
customer_reviews.author: swald627

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this mobo
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for 6 months and no problems. Was easy to install with Windows 10. The processor is an Intel i3 6100.
customer_reviews.author: mr. plow

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this mother board. It's a nicely built mother board. First time I ever built my gaming PC and works perfectly! Right in my budget too!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Purchased to build a rig and so far enjoy the BIOS and options it gives
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to build a rig and so far enjoy the BIOS and options it gives. Not much to say other than it just works.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Barrios

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Built a gaming PC with this and I have zero complaints. Performs perfectly for me!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The motherboard is fairly easy to use and it is priced very generously low for all of its nice elements.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Instructions bad, mobo good
customer_reviews.text: This was my second PC build and I used this motherboard. The instructions aren't great, and I had to redo some of the leads because I had the positive/negative swapped. I had to come find a review here that had a better diagram. Other than that, works great and no problems since my build.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Holland

customer_reviews.title: Nice and compact.  Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Work as expected... Nice board overall, but right now I need the screws for the ssd and it doesn't come with any (I guess we can blame Kingstone for not putting any on the ssd package as well)
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Escobar Arroyo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic board. No issues on 4 builds using an ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic board. No issues on 4 builds using an i5 7500
customer_reviews.author: kris

customer_reviews.title: Its good for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Best first build i could ask for Highly recommend it with a celeron or pentium processor or any othe lga 1151
customer_reviews.author: Psion

customer_reviews.title: Dud.
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of time. Posted only once to bios, after that, brick.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Boesch

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard. Had trouble with my board
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard. Had trouble with my board, but received a replacement shortly after. If you are instllling an M2 SSD, make sure it’s compatible (WD Blue 3d’s are Not compatible according to Asus). This has become my standard board.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Braillard

customer_reviews.title: No problems. Great board.
customer_reviews.text: Nice all around motheboard. Well woth the cost. I had no problems. I used the i5-7500
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great motherboard do be weary size is a bit off but its pretty good using it right now.
customer_reviews.author: Fantastic

customer_reviews.title: Defective Motherboard Sent
customer_reviews.text: When I tried to install my computer, apparently this motherboard was defective.
customer_reviews.author: Sean D

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I do not expect to receive used items when purchasing. This is totally unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen West

customer_reviews.title: The clip on the pci-e to hold the card brakes off easy. It still holds on to the card but ...
customer_reviews.text: Mobo was a bit smaller than what I wanted. And with a gpu it covering two of the sata connections. The clip on the pci-e to hold the card brakes off easy. It still holds on to the card but you don't a fully locked card. Hard to read where the pins for the front connection are. Wouldn't pay full price for it.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel C.

customer_reviews.title: Not working. CPU slot has problem. CPU, ...
customer_reviews.text: Not working. CPU slot has problem. CPU, RAM, power supply all work if they are tested separately. But they don't work in this board
customer_reviews.author: fatfish2005

customer_reviews.title: Problem after problem
customer_reviews.text: After waiting nearly two weeks for this motherboard to arrive in the mail, it has given me problem after problem with BIOS related issues that were extraordinarily obtuse in fixing. I have always loved ASUS products, but this is simply a troublesome motherboard. I recommend a different motherboard entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money if you want to install Windows 7!!!
customer_reviews.text: First off ASUS is one of my favorite boards. However a Windows 7 graphics driver is on the website but fails with a "Operating system not supported"/ Further research shows that it is a known issue and there really is NO DRIVER FOR WINDOWS 7. If you are thinking of using this board and a new processor for a Win 7 install forget it. It is known to have stability issues in Win 7. Surely disappointed. I guess this is the way the ASUS and Intel have gotten in bed to kill Windows 7 for the crap operating system Window 10. (Garbage)
customer_reviews.author: R. Tallman

customer_reviews.title: Hate it hate it hate it :(
customer_reviews.text: Don't do it. Ordered twice and both went bad after trying overclocking (not extreme at all) my gpu powered by the mobo.
customer_reviews.author: JKS

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this motherboard for multiple GPU or for customer service
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this motherboard for multiple GPU or for customer service. I contacted the manufacturer since he motherboard is unable to run multiple GPUs and they do not want to budge and instead want me to buy a different motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Maryluz Betancourt

customer_reviews.title: When your old and can not see as well quit building computers
customer_reviews.text: Loved the board until all usb ports quit working. Sent it back to Asus for warranty repair but when it arrived at service center they said cpu pins were bent and not covered by warranty. I guess I should have lived with the usb pcie card I installed to make it work, however I had invested money in ram and M.2 ssd for the motherboard, so I bit the bullet and bought another board just like it. Hope this one doesn't fail in 4 months like the first.
customer_reviews.author: Dewayne Winn

customer_reviews.title: The first one I was shipped had the socket cover ...
customer_reviews.text: The first one I was shipped had the socket cover for the CPU just floating around in the bag, not in the socket. Which unfortunately resulted in a couple bent pins and a computer that won't post. I'll update this when I get the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: John

product_meta.title: ASUS PRIME B250M-A LGA1151 DDR4 HDMI DVI VGA M.2 B250 mATX Motherboard with USB 3.1
product_meta.description: Size:Micro ATX| Style:PRIME B250M-AReady for 7th generation Intel Core processors, the Prime B250M-A delivers customizable performance in style. 5X Protection III with FanXpert 2 PLUS provides hardware-level safeguards. CrossFireX drives support for Multiple GPUs, while Dual M.2 slots and USB 3.1 deliver maximum transfer speeds. Create your unique build with 3D printing mounts.
feature_bullets: Maximize your connectivity and speed with integrated Dual M.2 slots with Intel Optane Memory compatibility and a rear USB 3.1 Type C connection
5X Protection III Hardware-level safeguards provide component longevity and reliability. LAN : ASUS LAN Guard, Realtek RTL8111H, 1 x Gigabit LAN Controller(s)
FanXpert 2 PLUS delivers advanced fan control with an integrated AIO pump header for dynamic cooling
Dual Patent-pending Safe Slot Core fortified PCIe slot prevents damage caused by heavyweight GPUs
On-board 3D-printing mounts for creating unique designs on your customized build

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars297 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
